term.title: arenium ions
term.intro: Cations derived formally by the addition of a @H02904@ or other cationic species to any position of an arene, e.g. C6H7+, benzenium. The term includes:

item.text: Arenium σ-adducts (Wheland intermediates) (which are considered to be intermediates in electrophilic aromatic substitution reactions) and other cyclohexadienyl cations. [image: nitrobenzenium ion]
Arenium π-adducts, such as: [image: benzenium ion]

term.sources: 'Glossary of class names of organic compounds and reactivity intermediates based on structure (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' Moss, G.P.;Smith, P.A.S.;Tavernier, D.; Pure and Applied Chemistry 1995 67(8-9) 1307
